item.title: Sagence is building analog chips to run AI
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Graphics processing units (GPUs), the chips on which most AI models run, are energy-hungry beasts. As a consequence of the accelerating incorporation of GPUs in data centers, AI will drive a 160% uptick in electricity demand by 2030, Goldman Sachs estimates. The trend isn’t sustainable, argues Vishal Sarin, an analog and memory circuit designer. After […]

item.title: Yuka, the app that rates food and makeup, now lets users complain to companies directly
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Yuka is a popular health app that allows users to scan the barcodes of food items to quickly see a health ranking based on additives, sugar, saturated fat, and fiber. It also scans cosmetic products, highlighting any harmful substances like endocrine disruptors, carcinogens, allergens, and irritants. Yuka then recommends healthier options, helping consumers make more […]

item.title: Socium doubles down on Francophone Africa after $5M seed round
item.dc:creator: Annie Njanja
item.description:
Demand for HR-tech solutions in Africa is growing, and Senegal’s Socium is out to tap the opportunity in French-speaking countries on the continent. Socium has since 2021 built HR solutions that target users within the 21 countries of Francophone Africa and plans to continue narrowing its focus on the region, where it is enjoying first-mover […]

item.title: Logitech’s MX console for creatives
item.dc:creator: Yashad Kulkarni
item.description:
Deep into Adobe apps like Photoshop or Premiere? Logitech’s MX Creative Console is designed to streamline your creative workflow with a totally customizable dialpad and keypad. Use the dial or wheel to quickly scrub through timelines in Premiere, detailed brush precision in Photoshop, or cycle through presets on Lightroom. Adding functions and icons is as […]

item.title: Ben Affleck tells actors and writers not to worry about AI
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Unions representing Hollywood actors and writers went on strike last year to secure protections against AI systems taking their jobs. But Ben Affleck says that actors and screenwriters shouldn’t worry about AI because it’s not capable of doing either job today, and likely won’t for a long time. “Movies will be one of the last […]

item.title: Venture funding in Europe fell to $45 billion in 2024, says Atomico
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
Funding for European tech appears to have stabilized in 2024 after dropping precipitously in 2023, but the signs continue to point to more tough times ahead, according to the latest State of European Tech report.  The annual survey, produced by European VC firm Atomico, notes that startups in the region are on track to raise […]

item.title: Justice Department reportedly pushing Google to spin off Chrome
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
The Department of Justice is reportedly pushing to force Google to spin off its Chrome browser business. That’s according to Bloomberg, which reports that the Justice Department is also planning to recommend to a federal judge that Google face antitrust requirements related to AI and its Android mobile operating system. The enforcement actions are the […]

item.title: TechCrunch Space: A big pivot
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
Hello, and welcome back to TechCrunch Space! This week, SpaceX President Gwynne Shotwell said she wouldn’t be surprised if the company launched Starship 400 times over the next four years. What do you think? How realistic are those numbers, on the scale of “almost certain” to “no chance in hell”? I believe SpaceX has the […]

item.title: ServiceTitan names LLMs from Microsoft, OpenAI as risk factors
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description:
With ServiceTitan's public IPO documents, we may be witnessing the birth of a new boilerplate warning: LLMs.

item.title: In 2023 VCs returned the lowest level of capital to their investors since 2011
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
It’s no secret that the venture capital industry is facing a liquidity crisis as IPOs and other exits remain few and far between after 2020 and 2021’s record-breaking years. Now, we have numbers that show just how bad it’s gotten. In 2023, the U.S. VC industry invested $60 billion more into startups than it collected […]

item.title: Trump’s FCC pick has said he wants to ban TikTok, challenge Section 230
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Though President-elect Donald Trump has been expected to stop the looming ban on TikTok, his political appointments suggest otherwise. Trump announced on Sunday that he selected Brendan Carr to chair the Federal Communications Commission (FCC), which regulates the internet, news media, and other forms of communication. Carr, whom Trump appointed to the FCC in 2017, […]

item.title: DoorDash’s app can now import your grocery list for faster shopping
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
While online grocery shopping is generally convenient, manually adding items to your cart one by one can become a bit of a chore. To address this, food and grocery shopping app DoorDash has launched a new feature that allows you to sync your grocery list to the app. The app will then suggest what to […]

item.title: Marlon Nichols talks relationship building in the African markets
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description:
Marlon Nichols took the stage at AfroTech last week to discuss the importance of building relationships when it comes to entering into a new market. “One of the first things you do when you go to a new market is you’ve got to meet the new players,” he said. “Like, what do people need? What’s […]

item.title: Venture capitalists continue to play musical chairs
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
From Keith Rabois to Ethan Kurzweil, a lot of VCs have switched firms or spun out of storied VC institutions to launch their own funds this year. These employment changes are surprising because unlike in many other fields, venture capitalists don’t traditionally move around very much — especially those who reach the partner or general […]

item.title: OpenAI investor Josh Kushner praises Musk, despite Musk’s OpenAI lawsuit
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description:
Elon Musk may be suing OpenAI, accusing the ChatGPT maker of abandoning the company’s original mission as a nonprofit organization, but Josh Kushner, founder of Thrive Capital and one of the company’s key investors, has nothing but good things to say about the world’s richest man. “I have deep admiration and respect for Elon,” Kushner […]

item.title: Trump’s pro-fracking energy secretary pick has also invested in geothermal and nuclear startups

item.description:
Chris Wright has been a big booster of oil and gas, but he's also no stranger to climate tech.

item.title: Former TuSimple co-founder urges courts to block asset transfer to China
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Xiaodi Hou, the co-founder and former CEO of self-driving trucking startup TuSimple, has urged a California district court to issue a temporary restraining order to stop the company from transferring its remaining U.S. assets to China, according to a recent court filing. Hou, who plans to apply for a temporary restraining order in December during […]

item.title: Mastodon sees a boost from the ‘X exodus,’ too, founder says
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Decentralized social network Mastodon is also seeing some uplift from the X “exodus,” founder Eugen Rochko shared on the platform just ahead of the weekend. While the Twitter-like startup Bluesky has been capturing headlines and attention for its rapid adoption among former X users, a smaller group has apparently turned to the open source networking […]

item.title: Healthcare VC firm Initiate has a new $45M and has already founded five startups internally

item.description:
Jessica Owens and Iana Dimkova, co-founders of Initiate Ventures, are launching their new healthcare/ life sciences-focused firm with a respectable $45 million debut fund. item.title: Gadget lover Marc Benioff says his favorite gadget these days is his cars and trucks
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description:
Marc Benioff famously got into tech as a child coder writing games. He’s always loved tech gadgets. During an episode of TechCrunch’s Equity podcast, when asked about his latest gadgets, he showed off his Oura ring. But then he considered and said that his favorite gadget these days is his car. “I think my car […]
